snippet: For some who doubt that gridlock on the George Washington Bridge was simply a matter of political punishment, a construction site near the bridge has spurred a collective “Aha!”
abstract: Some observers have speculated that allies of New Jersey Gov Chris Christie engineered traffic jam near George Washington Bridge not as revenge against Fort Lee Mayor Mark J Sokolich, commonly accepted explanation, but because of reasons tied to nearby commercial development.
lead_paragraph: For some who doubt that gridlock on the George Washington Bridge was simply a matter of political punishment, a construction site near the bridge has spurred a collective “Aha!”

headline.main: Traffic Jam Investigator Offers Ulterior Motive
headline.print_headline: Traffic Jam Investigator Offers Ulterior Motive
